title: Marketing Coordinator
description: Are you creative, resourceful, talented, and ready to get to work in Denver? Do you like a fast-paced environment that rewards success? Join Kimley-Horn’s growing marketing team and help influence client and project strategy; coordinate, write, and collaborate on proposals and thought leadership; and promote the firm. Coordinate, format, write, edit, proofread, and manage process for development of proposals, statements of qualifications, technical documents, and related marketing materialsManage multiple concurrent time sensitive deadlinesCraft strong messaging and themes for marketing effortsAssist with creative conceptualization and design of proposal, which includes coordinating with and supporting graphic design partnersCollaborate with engineers, marketing staff, and regional team leaders throughout the entire proposal development cycle and support with research, writing, editing, formatting and quality check of text and graphicsLead meetings with engineering/planning professionals and project teams.Facilitate presentation preparationsCoordinate conferences, open houses, and client eventsUpdate and maintain marketing database Bachelor’s in Communications, Journalism, Marketing, Public Relations, English, or a similar field2-6 years of related writing, proposal coordination, or marketing experience (A/E/C industry is preferred, but not required)Basic knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft OfficeStrong organizational, writing, editing, and proofreading skillsDetail-orientedPositive attitude/client-service focusedFlexibility to periodically work outside normal working hoursWillingness to occasionally travel (as required) for business needsSalary Range:$63,000 - $86,000 *Please include a one-page cover letter when uploading your resume. Additional writing work samples may be requested. About Kimley-Horn We are a full-service consulting firm that provides a wide range of infrastructure and land development planning and engineering services to both public and private clients. Though we have more than 7,000 employees in 110+ offices, we pride ourselves on our small company feel.At Kimley-Horn, we do things differently. People—clients and employees—are at the forefront of our business. Clients know we are laser-focused on their success. Employees know our culture and approach to business are built on a desire to see our staff flourish, one and all. Both groups know that with Kimley-Horn, they can expect more and experience better.Our commitment to quality is only as good as the people behind it—that’s why we recruit passionate, hardworking, and proactive employees. By joining Kimley-Horn, you’ll be joining a firm whose core values and core purpose are more than just words on paper—they form the basis of a culture that has yielded success since 1967. 16 years on Fortune’s "100 Best Companies to Work For" including Best Workplaces for Women and Best Workplaces for Millennials.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description: Kimley-Horn is looking for a Product Marketer to join our firmwide technology solutions team! As our entry level Product Marketing Coordinator, you will assist the technology solutions team in developing and implementing marketing activities to generate new business leads and increase awareness of Kimley-Horn’s technology solutions. This is a highly cross-functional role with great opportunity to expand Kimley-Horn’s software business in its next stages of growth.  Collaborate with internal teams to effectively plan and execute marketing activitiesWrite and edit content for product promotional collateralTranslate product features and benefits into customer-facing messagingSupport the organization and implementation of special projects/eventsResearch and observe the market landscape and activities of competitorsConduct market research to determine a target audience’s needs, wants, habits, interests, and other factors used in creating targeted marketing campaignsAbility to think critically and generate new ideas for marketing and research activitiesPerform other duties as needed or assigned Bachelor’s in Communications, Journalism, Marketing, Public Relations, English, Human-Centered Design, or a similar field1-2 years of experience in marketing, sales, customer service, or event settingsExceptional verbal and written communication skillsCreative, flexible, and results-orientedExcellent organization and time management skillsTeam player with a positive attitude/client service mentalityBasic knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office**Please include a one-page cover letter when uploading your resume. By joining Kimley-Horn, you’ll be joining a firm whose core values and core purpose are more than just words on paper—they form the basis of a culture that has yielded success since 1967. Kimley-Horn has been recognized 15 times as one of the "Top Companies to Work For".   Below is a list of Benefits Provided by Kimley-Horn:Retirement contributions include a 2-to-1 401(k) match on the first 4% and a discretionary profit-sharing contributionProfit sharing in 2020 was 10%, leading to an employer contribution of 18% (variable based on profits of firm)Performance Based Bonus CompensationHealth Savings Account - Company paid HSA contributionMedical Insurance - Insurance that includes a no month premium optionDental insuranceVision insurancePaid Time Off - Varies based on experience and classificationTuition reimbursementBack-up Childcare - Company-paid back-up childcareEmployee referral program for bringing great people to the firmNew Parent LeaveShort-Term DisabilityLong-Term DisabilityVoluntary Life InsuranceGroup Term Life InsuranceEmployee Assistance ProgramHealth AdvocateFinancial AdvisorsDependent Care FSAAccidental Death and Dismemberment

title: Graphic Designer
description: OverviewAt Kimley-Horn, our in-house creative teams are integral to every aspect of our business. We use design to differentiate Kimley-Horn in the marketplace; to create understanding around and excitement for projects in local communities; and to energize and connect our employees. The following is a description of a Graphic Designer in our Regional Marketing department.If you are mapping out the next phase of your design career and seeking creative opportunities with an entrepreneurial spirit, join Kimley-Horn’s Design team in Seattle, WA. Our Graphic Designers work independently, partnering with Junior Designers and other Marketing professionals to understand and translate the client’s vision and design a variety of deliverables in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Exploration of personal growth, new skills, and leadership opportunities are part of Kimley-Horn’s culture and encouraged in this position. Hop on board!Responsibilities Develop graphic covers, templates, layouts, and supporting graphics for marketing pursuits  Create presentations, aerial map exhibits, and multimedia graphics  Create tailored, print and digital brochures as well as conference/event graphics  Design digital campaigns for external recognition/pursuits  Thrive as part of a large, creative, and specialized marketing team  Partner with engineers, project managers, and technical staff  Serve as a brand advocate for Kimley-Horn and the client’s visual guidelines QualificationsRequired Qualifications BA/BS in Graphic Design or similar  4+ years of corporate and/or agency experience  Proficiency in Adobe CC (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, and Acrobat) and Microsoft Office Suite (Kimley-Horn is a PC-based company)  Ability to use InDesign software for layout of complex documents  Strong verbal and written communication skills  A positive, collaborative, solution-seeking attitude, and a high sense of personal responsibility  Desire to learn new skills, manage tasks and teams, participate in process improvement  Flexibility to periodically work outside normal business hours as needed  Ability to work under tight deadlines and handle simultaneous, varied assignments while providing consistent quality and accuracy  Willingness to travel in support of remote projects and teams Desired Qualifications Experience with video filming/editing (Adobe Premiere) and/or motion graphics (Adobe After Effects)  Experience with 3D visualization software  Web design experience – WordPress preferred with HTML / CSS knowledge Please submit a link to your online portfolio, or 5-10 PDF work samples with your applicationSalary Range$70,000 - $85,000

title: Administrative Assistant
description: OverviewKimley-Horn is looking for an Administrative Assistant to join our Sacramento, CA office!Work Schedule: Monday - Thursday 8:00am - 5:00pResponsibilities General front desk reception duties: answering phones, greeting clients and guests, maintaining conference room calendars, ordering supplies  Assisting with word processing including revising client proposals and fee estimates, scope of services, forms, progress reports, and other project documents  Mail distribution; FedEx distribution (outgoing and incoming)  Assistance in producing plans, project manuals and reports (copying, printing, binding, filing and/or scanning documents)  Compile meeting agendas, minutes and miscellaneous other documents  Proactively manage Outlook calendars (meetings/call scheduling), as well as travel and expense reports  Effectively partnering with other staff and senior leaders  Ordering supplies; Maintenance/upkeep of production and supply rooms; occasional heavy lifting required  Scheduling meetings/setting up AV presentation equipment  Assisting with event planning and coordination  Filing and archiving  Running occasional office related errands Qualifications 3-5 years in a corporate/professional environment in an Administrative role  Strong verbal and written communication skills (grammar/proofreading)  Strong proficiency in MS Office Suite; highly proficient in Excel, Word, and Outlook  Professional, organized, client-oriented, and deadline driven  Able to anticipate needs and manage multiple competing priorities  Positive team player with commitment to quality  Self-starter who can thrive in an environment where leaders often travel off site serving clients  Contract management and billing experience preferred  Proven ability to maintain confidentiality Salary Range$52,000 - $70,000At Kimley-Horn, we do things differently. title: Marketing Coordinator
description: OverviewAre you creative, resourceful, talented, and ready to get to work in Orlando? Do you like a fast-paced environment that rewards success? Join Kimley-Horn’s growing marketing team and help influence client and project strategy; coordinate, write, and collaborate on proposals and thought leadership; and promote the firm.Responsibilities Prepare/write proposals, qualifications, letters, reports, presentations, brochures, award submittals, and other communications  Facilitate, coordinate, and participate in kick-off meetings and proposal production activities  Coordinate with consultant firms for teaming and gathering marketing materials  Communicate and interact with professionals, project managers, and technical staff  Conduct marketing database queries as well as input data and maintain accuracy of data on an ongoing basis  Coordinate other special projects such as conferences, open houses, and client events  Interview subject matter experts and write/edit technical content for target audiences Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Communication, Marketing, Education, or other relevant major  Strong technical writing, editing, interpersonal, and organizational skills  Software proficiency in Microsoft Office Word and Adobe InDesign  Travel (driving) to other offices within the region as needed  0-5 years of professional consulting service experience is required; A/E/C industry experience is a plus Please include a one-page cover letter when uploading your resume. Additional work samples and/or basic writing skills testing will be required.  Applicants must be legally authorized to work for Kimley-Horn in the U.S. without employer sponsorship. We do not typically sponsor H1-B or any other work visa petitions. Why Kimley-HornWe are a full-service consulting firm that provides a wide range of infrastructure and land development planning and engineering services to both public and private clients. Though we have more than 5,000 employees in over 90 offices, we pride ourselves on our small company feel.Our commitment to quality is only as good as the people behind it—that’s why we recruit passionate, hardworking, and proactive employees. By joining Kimley-Horn, you’ll be joining a firm whose core values and core purpose are more than just words on paper—they form the basis of a culture that has yielded success since 1967. Kimley-Horn has been recognized 15 times as one of the "Top Companies to Work For". Below Is a List Of Benefits Provided By Kimley-Horn Retirement contributions include a 2-to-1 401(k) match on the first 4% and a discretionary profit-sharing contribution  Profit sharing in 2020 was 10%, leading to an employer contribution of 18% (variable based on profits of firm)  Performance Based Bonus Compensation  Health Savings Account – Company paid HSA contribution  Medical Insurance - Insurance that includes a no month premium option  Dental insurance  Vision insurance  Paid Time Off – Varies based on experience and classification  Tuition reimbursement  Back-up Childcare - Company-paid back-up childcare  Employee referral program for bringing great people to the firm  New Parent Leave  Short-Term Disability  Long-Term Disability  Voluntary Life Insurance  Group Term Life Insurance  Employee Assistance Program  Health Advocate  Financial Advisors  Dependent Care FSA  Accidental Death and Dismemberment

title: Graphic Designer
description: Overview At Kimley-Horn, our in-house creative teams are integral to every aspect of our business. We use design to differentiate Kimley-Horn in the marketplace; to create understanding around and excitement for projects in local communities; and to energize and connect our employees. The following is a description of a Graphic Designer in our regional Marketing department.If you are mapping out the next phase of your design career and seeking creative opportunities with an entrepreneurial spirit, join Kimley-Horn’s Design team in Atlanta Midtown. Our Graphic Designers work independently, partnering with Junior Designers and other Marketing professionals to understand and translate the client’s vision and design a variety of deliverables in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Exploration of personal growth, new skills, and leadership opportunities are part of Kimley-Horn’s culture and encouraged in this position. Hop on board! Responsibilities As a Graphic Designer on our Marketing team, you will be responsible for the creative development of a wide variety of deliverables in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary team environment. The ideal candidate will be an energetic, focused, multi-talented design professional with a mix of graphic design and multimedia skills that will enable multi-tasking in WordPress, email, presentation design, and collateral development.This is an in-office position.Responsibilities: Develop graphic covers, templates, layouts, and supporting graphics for marketing pursuits  Create presentations, aerial map exhibits, and multimedia graphics  Create tailored, print and digital brochures as well as conference/event graphics  Design digital campaigns for external recognition/pursuits  Thrive as part of a large, creative, and specialized marketing team  Partner with engineers, project managers, and technical staff  Serve as a brand advocate for Kimley-Horn and the client’s visual guidelines  Qualifications  BA/BS in Graphic Design or similar  2+ years of corporate and/or agency experience  Proficiency in Adobe CC (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, and Acrobat) and Microsoft Office Suite (Kimley-Horn is a PC-based company)  Ability to use InDesign software for layout of complex documents  Strong verbal and written communication skills  A positive, collaborative, solution-seeking attitude, and a high sense of personal responsibility  Desire to learn new skills, manage tasks and teams, participate in process improvement  Flexibility to periodically work outside normal business hours as needed  Ability to work under tight deadlines and handle simultaneous, varied assignments while providing consistent quality and accuracy  Willingness to travel in support of remote projects and teams

title: On-site Recruiter
description: OverviewKimley-Horn, one of Fortune Magazine's "100 Best Companies to Work For", is a dynamic and rapidly growing consutling firm specializing in planning and engineering. Our team of talented professionals is dedicated to providing exceptional client service while upholding our core values of honesty, integrity, and sustained profitability. We believe in creating an environment where our people can flourish, and we are looking for a Mid-Level Recruiter to join our team in Denver, CO.As a Mid-Level Recruiter, you will play a vital role in attracting and selecting top talent for our organization. You will collaborate closely with hiring managers, understand their staffing needs, and execute effective recruiting strategies to identify and engage qualified candidates. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to our growth and shape the future of our team.ResponsibilitiesWork closely with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and develop effective recruitment strategies.Utilize various sourcing techniques such as job boards, social media, networking events, and employee referrals to identify and attract qualified candidates.Review resumes, conduct phone screens, and interview candidates to assess their skills, experience, and cultural fit.Partner with recruiting team working together collectively to find the best solutations and creative ideas to attract and hire talent.Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and provide timely feedback to candidates.Conduct reference checks and background screenings as required.Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in our applicant tracking system.Collaborate with the HR team to ensure a seamless onboarding process for new hires.Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging recruitment technologies to continuously improve our recruiting processes.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.Minimum of 3+ years of experience in recruitment, preferably in a similar industry or niche.Proven track record of successfully sourcing and selecting qualified candidates.Strong knowledge of various sourcing techniques and recruitment tools.Strong organizational skills, drive to Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with hiring managers and candidates.Exceptional organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems and other recruitment software.How to Apply: If you are a motivated and results-oriented individual who thrives in a collaborative and growth-focused environment, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your qualifications and interest in the Mid-Level Recruiter position in Denver, CO.Why Kimley-HornWe are a full-service consulting firm that provides a wide range of infrastructure and land development planning and engineering services to both public and private clients. Though we have more than 7,000 employees in over 100 offices, we pride ourselves on our small company feel.Our commitment to quality is only as good as the people behind it—that’s why we recruit passionate, hardworking, and proactive employees. By joining Kimley-Horn, you’ll be joining a firm whose core values and core purpose are more than just words on paper—they form the basis of a culture that has yielded success since 1967. Kimley-Horn has been recognized 16 times as one of the "Top Companies to Work For". Salary Range $80,000-$100,000  Eligible for performance-based bonus compensation

Professional presence and charisma, with the ability to create strong working relationships with internal and external staff.

title: Graphic Designer
description: Overview At Kimley-Horn, our in-house creative teams are integral to every aspect of our business. We use design to differentiate Kimley-Horn in the marketplace; to create understanding around and excitement for projects in local communities; and to energize and connect our employees. The following is a description of a Graphic Designer in our regional Marketing department.If you are mapping out the next phase of your design career and seeking creative opportunities with an entrepreneurial spirit, join Kimley-Horn’s Design team in Atlanta Midtown. Our Graphic Designers work independently, partnering with Junior Designers and other Marketing professionals to understand and translate the client’s vision and design a variety of deliverables in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Exploration of personal growth, new skills, and leadership opportunities are part of Kimley-Horn’s culture and encouraged in this position. Hop on board! Responsibilities As a Graphic Designer on our Marketing team, you will be responsible for the creative development of a wide variety of deliverables in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary team environment. The ideal candidate will be an energetic, focused, multi-talented design professional with a mix of graphic design and multimedia skills that will enable multi-tasking in WordPress, email, presentation design, and collateral development.This is an in-office position.Responsibilities: Develop graphic covers, templates, layouts, and supporting graphics for marketing pursuits  Create presentations, aerial map exhibits, and multimedia graphics  Create tailored, print and digital brochures as well as conference/event graphics  Design digital campaigns for external recognition/pursuits  Thrive as part of a large, creative, and specialized marketing team  Partner with engineers, project managers, and technical staff  Serve as a brand advocate for Kimley-Horn and the client’s visual guidelines  Qualifications  BA/BS in Graphic Design or similar  2+ years of corporate and/or agency experience  Proficiency in Adobe CC (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, and Acrobat) and Microsoft Office Suite (Kimley-Horn is a PC-based company)  Ability to use InDesign software for layout of complex documents  Strong verbal and written communication skills  A positive, collaborative, solution-seeking attitude, and a high sense of personal responsibility  Desire to learn new skills, manage tasks and teams, participate in process improvement  Flexibility to periodically work outside normal business hours as needed  Ability to work under tight deadlines and handle simultaneous, varied assignments while providing consistent quality and accuracy  Willingness to travel in support of remote projects and teams

title: Marketing Coordinator
description: Kimley-Horn is looking for a Product Marketer to join our firmwide technology solutions team! As our entry level Product Marketing Coordinator, you will assist the technology solutions team in developing and implementing marketing activities to generate new business leads and increase awareness of Kimley-Horn’s technology solutions. This is a highly cross-functional role with great opportunity to expand Kimley-Horn’s software business in its next stages of growth.  Collaborate with internal teams to effectively plan and execute marketing activitiesWrite and edit content for product promotional collateralTranslate product features and benefits into customer-facing messagingSupport the organization and implementation of special projects/eventsResearch and observe the market landscape and activities of competitorsConduct market research to determine a target audience’s needs, wants, habits, interests, and other factors used in creating targeted marketing campaignsAbility to think critically and generate new ideas for marketing and research activitiesPerform other duties as needed or assigned Bachelor’s in Communications, Journalism, Marketing, Public Relations, English, Human-Centered Design, or a similar field1-2 years of experience in marketing, sales, customer service, or event settingsExceptional verbal and written communication skillsCreative, flexible, and results-orientedExcellent organization and time management skillsTeam player with a positive attitude/client service mentalityBasic knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office**Please include a one-page cover letter when uploading your resume. Additional work samples and/or basic writing skills testing will be required. Applicants must be legally authorized to work for Kimley-Horn in the U.S. without employer sponsorship. title: Graphic Designer
description: OverviewAt Kimley-Horn, our in-house creative teams are integral to every aspect of our business. We use design to differentiate Kimley-Horn in the marketplace; to create understanding around and excitement for projects in local communities; and to energize and connect our employees. The following is a description of a Graphic Designer in our Regional Marketing department.If you are mapping out the next phase of your design career and seeking creative opportunities with an entrepreneurial spirit, join Kimley-Horn’s Design team in Seattle, WA. Our Graphic Designers work independently, partnering with Junior Designers and other Marketing professionals to understand and translate the client’s vision and design a variety of deliverables in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Exploration of personal growth, new skills, and leadership opportunities are part of Kimley-Horn’s culture and encouraged in this position. Hop on board!Responsibilities Develop graphic covers, templates, layouts, and supporting graphics for marketing pursuits  Create presentations, aerial map exhibits, and multimedia graphics  Create tailored, print and digital brochures as well as conference/event graphics  Design digital campaigns for external recognition/pursuits  Thrive as part of a large, creative, and specialized marketing team  Partner with engineers, project managers, and technical staff  Serve as a brand advocate for Kimley-Horn and the client’s visual guidelines QualificationsRequired Qualifications BA/BS in Graphic Design or similar  4+ years of corporate and/or agency experience  Proficiency in Adobe CC (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, and Acrobat) and Microsoft Office Suite (Kimley-Horn is a PC-based company)  Ability to use InDesign software for layout of complex documents  Strong verbal and written communication skills  A positive, collaborative, solution-seeking attitude, and a high sense of personal responsibility  Desire to learn new skills, manage tasks and teams, participate in process improvement  Flexibility to periodically work outside normal business hours as needed  Ability to work under tight deadlines and handle simultaneous, varied assignments while providing consistent quality and accuracy  Willingness to travel in support of remote projects and teams Desired Qualifications Experience with video filming/editing (Adobe Premiere) and/or motion graphics (Adobe After Effects)  Experience with 3D visualization software  Web design experience – WordPress preferred with HTML / CSS knowledge Please submit a link to your online portfolio, or 5-10 PDF work samples with your applicationSalary Range$70,000 - $85,000

description: OverviewKimley-Horn, one of Fortune Magazine's "100 Best Companies to Work For", is a dynamic and rapidly growing consutling firm specializing in planning and engineering. Our team of talented professionals is dedicated to providing exceptional client service while upholding our core values of honesty, integrity, and sustained profitability. We believe in creating an environment where our people can flourish, and we are looking for a Mid-Level Recruiter to join our team in Denver, CO.As a Mid-Level Recruiter, you will play a vital role in attracting and selecting top talent for our organization. You will collaborate closely with hiring managers, understand their staffing needs, and execute effective recruiting strategies to identify and engage qualified candidates. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to our growth and shape the future of our team.ResponsibilitiesWork closely with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and develop effective recruitment strategies.Utilize various sourcing techniques such as job boards, social media, networking events, and employee referrals to identify and attract qualified candidates.Review resumes, conduct phone screens, and interview candidates to assess their skills, experience, and cultural fit.Partner with recruiting team working together collectively to find the best solutations and creative ideas to attract and hire talent.Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and provide timely feedback to candidates.Conduct reference checks and background screenings as required.Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in our applicant tracking system.Collaborate with the HR team to ensure a seamless onboarding process for new hires.Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging recruitment technologies to continuously improve our recruiting processes.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.Minimum of 3+ years of experience in recruitment, preferably in a similar industry or niche.Proven track record of successfully sourcing and selecting qualified candidates.Strong knowledge of various sourcing techniques and recruitment tools.Strong organizational skills, drive to Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with hiring managers and candidates.Exceptional organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems and other recruitment software.How to Apply: If you are a motivated and results-oriented individual who thrives in a collaborative and growth-focused environment, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your qualifications and interest in the Mid-Level Recruiter position in Denver, CO.Why Kimley-HornWe are a full-service consulting firm that provides a wide range of infrastructure and land development planning and engineering services to both public and private clients. Though we have more than 7,000 employees in over 100 offices, we pride ourselves on our small company feel.Our commitment to quality is only as good as the people behind it—that’s why we recruit passionate, hardworking, and proactive employees. By joining Kimley-Horn, you’ll be joining a firm whose core values and core purpose are more than just words on paper—they form the basis of a culture that has yielded success since 1967. Kimley-Horn has been recognized 16 times as one of the "Top Companies to Work For". Salary Range $80,000-$100,000  Eligible for performance-based bonus compensation

Professional presence and charisma, with the ability to create strong working relationships with internal and external staff.

title: In-house Counsel
description: OverviewKimley-Horn, one of Fortune Magazine’s “100 Best Companies to Work For,” is looking for an in-house counsel to join our corporate legal team in Raleigh, NC. This is a great opportunity, whether you are currently working as in-house counsel or interested in making a shift from private or public practice.This position will work with General Counsel and the legal team in managing a broad range of contracting, compliance, legal and risk matters for the company and its affiliates in a time sensitive environment. Candidates should have 2+ years of experience.Responsibilities Provide rapid, practical, business-oriented, and risk-aware legal advice Draft, review, and negotiate various design professional contracts and other legal documents Enhance standard contracting procedures and provide training Prepare and present legal trainings and risk management seminars to staff on a wide range of legal, risk, and compliance topics Manage operational compliance functions Collaborate with project personnel to proactively identify, assess, and mitigate risks and advise on dispute avoidance and risk mitigation strategies Coordinate efforts of and manage outside attorneys on a case-by-case basis Support subpoena and claims/litigation management, working with General Counsel, outside counsel, insurance representatives, and internal stakeholders as needed Support contracting, risk and compliance efforts for operations Collaborate with and facilitate cross-team decision-making amongst various internal stakeholders, including legal, finance, senior management, and other internal teams Perform other duties as needed Some travel required (approx. 10%)Qualifications Juris Doctor degree from an accredited law school Licensed to practice law in a U.S. state or Washington, D.C. 2+ years of legal experience Strong interpersonal skills, including verbal communication, presentation, and relationship building Exceptionally organized in thought and with documentation Ability to maintain confidentiality and provide excellent internal and external client service Excellent follow-through skills as well as the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment Ability and desire to partner with diverse and dynamic leadership and teams Proficient in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook Prior experience in Intellectual Property/Technology law is a plus

Join Kimley-Horn’s growing marketing team and help influence client and project strategy; coordinate, write, and collaborate on proposals and thought leadership; and promote the firm.ResponsibilitiesLead meetings with engineering/planning professionals and project teams.Research business opportunities and assist in strategy development.Coordinate, format, write, edit, and proofread proposals, statements of qualifications, and related marketing materials.Facilitate interview preparations for project teams; coordinate with graphic designers to produce presentations; and oversee final production of presentation materials.Update and maintain project, employee, and client data in marketing database.Edit/proofread miscellaneous technical letters, reports, and other materials.Coordinate special projects/events, as needed.Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Communication, Marketing, Education, or other relevant major  8+ years of professional consulting service experience is required; A/E/C industry experience is a plus  Strong technical writing, editing, interpersonal, and organizational skills  Software proficiency in Microsoft Office Word and Adobe InDesign Ability to work under tight deadlines and handle multiple assignments concurrently Willingness to travel if needed Please include a one-page cover letter when uploading your resume. Additional writing work samples may be requested.

title: Electrical Analyst
description: OverviewWe have a challenging and highly rewarding opportunity for a motivated Electrical Engineer to help grow our expanding team in Orange, CA. This position provides an opportunity to work on a variety of renewables projects that will ensure your success and growth in your career. Additionally, you will contribute to the design of major projects from various markets locally and around the country.Responsibilities Design of electrical systems including solar, battery storage, electric vehicle charging and building electrical  Participate on project teams in an active production role  Participate in project meetings internally and externally with clients  Preparation of project specifications  Preparation of electrical construction cost estimates  Daily interaction and collaboration on cross-functional teams across multiple disciplines  Coordination and verification of as-built drawings  Perform quality work that promotes client retention  Responsible for the development of reports and design documents, including solar photovoltaic electrical site plans, equipment selection, photovoltaic module string sizing calculations, ampacity calculations and wire sizing Qualifications 2 to 6 years of design experience in electrical engineering specifically in any of the following: Solar PV design, Battery energy storage, or energy modeling  Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering (advanced degrees are a plus)  EIT or ability to obtain within 6 months required  Understanding of the National Electrical Code, other NFPA codes/standards, and energy codes  Proficiency using Computer-Aided Design and Drafting (AutoCAD)  Previous experience with solar production modeling is a plus  Previous experience with electrical solar photovoltaic design or battery storage is a plus  Passion for renewables  Building Information Modeling (BIM – Autodesk Revit) experience is a plus  Electrical power, lighting, and fire alarm design experience  Superior verbal and written communication skills  The ability to work independently or in a team environment effectively  The ability to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment Base Salary Range$85,000 to $110,000

title: Senior Marketing Specialist
description: OverviewOur Pleasanton/Bay Area offices are looking for a Marketing Specialist with 10+ years of A/E/C experience to join our regional marketing team. The primary purpose of this role is to be a catalyst for growth of the Water and Land Development practice. This will be done via identification, relationship building, pursuit, and proposal strategy for various targeted clients and projects.Responsibilities Assist in business development activities to ensure adequate, profitable new business is captured.  Research business opportunities and assist in strategy development.  Positively represent Kimley-Horn via active engagement in networking events, activities, and organizations.  Partner with project managers to strategize on their market forecast, upcoming opportunities, and other potential clients/projects.  Partner with the regional Marketing team to ensure proper support to project managers.  Favorably position the firm for existing and future market opportunities.  Support and lead (when appropriate) marketing efforts for proposals, presentations, and other direct work-winning activities.  Coordinate special projects/events, including regional conferences  Manage multiple concurrent time sensitive deadlines Qualifications Bachelor’s in Communications, Journalism, Marketing, Public Relations, English, or a similar field  10+ years of A/E/C industry experience  Flexibility to work outside normal working hours  Willingness to occasionally travel (as required) for business needs  Basic knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office  Confident communicator  Detail-oriented and proactive  Team player with a positive attitude/client service mentality  Strong ability to gather, interpret, and convey technical information Please include a one-page cover letter when uploading your resume. Additional work samples and/or basic writing skills testing will be required.Base Salary Range $105,000 - $135,000

title: Electrical Engineer
description: OverviewKimley-Horn has a challenging and rewarding opportunity for a motivated Electrical Engineer to join our team in our Midtown Atlanta office.Responsibilities Lead the design and analysis of complex electrical systems for renewable generation, energy storage, electric vehicle charging infrastructure, transportation, aviation, and industrial projects  Responsible for the development of design documents and reports, including electrical layouts, equipment schematics and block diagrams, electrical system calculations, and one-line diagrams  Daily interaction and collaboration on multi-disciplinary teams, with interaction across Kimley-Horn offices  Prepare project specifications, electrical construction cost estimates, and proposals, supporting the growth of electrical engineering service areas in the Atlanta market and across the country  Expected to assist in mentoring, training, and growing a team to expand our electrical engineering practice Required Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering  Prior experience in an Electrical Engineering role  Understanding of the National Electrical Code, National Electrical Safety Code, IEEE and ANSI Standards  P.E. License  Willingness to travel to support site visits and client meetings, as needed Preferred Experience in utility-scale PV, wind generation, energy storage, electric vehicle charging infrastructure, microgrid, substation, or data center designs  Experience in engineering project management  Proficiency in AutoCAD  Experience in power system analysis using SKM, ETAP, or equivalent  Experience in transient studies using PSCAD, EMTP-RV, or equivalent  Experience in lighting designs and photometrics using AGI32, or equivalent  Comfortable programming in Python or MATLAB

title: Graphic Designer
description: Overview At Kimley-Horn, our in-house creative teams are integral to every aspect of our business. We use design to differentiate Kimley-Horn in the marketplace; to create understanding around and excitement for projects in local communities; and to energize and connect our employees. The following is a description of a Graphic Designer in our regional Marketing department.If you are mapping out the next phase of your design career and seeking creative opportunities with an entrepreneurial spirit, join Kimley-Horn’s Design team in Atlanta Midtown. Our Graphic Designers work independently, partnering with Junior Designers and other Marketing professionals to understand and translate the client’s vision and design a variety of deliverables in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Exploration of personal growth, new skills, and leadership opportunities are part of Kimley-Horn’s culture and encouraged in this position. Hop on board! Responsibilities As a Graphic Designer on our Marketing team, you will be responsible for the creative development of a wide variety of deliverables in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary team environment. The ideal candidate will be an energetic, focused, multi-talented design professional with a mix of graphic design and multimedia skills that will enable multi-tasking in WordPress, email, presentation design, and collateral development.This is an in-office position.Responsibilities: Develop graphic covers, templates, layouts, and supporting graphics for marketing pursuits  Create presentations, aerial map exhibits, and multimedia graphics  Create tailored, print and digital brochures as well as conference/event graphics  Design digital campaigns for external recognition/pursuits  Thrive as part of a large, creative, and specialized marketing team  Partner with engineers, project managers, and technical staff  Serve as a brand advocate for Kimley-Horn and the client’s visual guidelines  Qualifications  BA/BS in Graphic Design or similar  2+ years of corporate and/or agency experience  Proficiency in Adobe CC (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, and Acrobat) and Microsoft Office Suite (Kimley-Horn is a PC-based company)  Ability to use InDesign software for layout of complex documents  Strong verbal and written communication skills  A positive, collaborative, solution-seeking attitude, and a high sense of personal responsibility  Desire to learn new skills, manage tasks and teams, participate in process improvement  Flexibility to periodically work outside normal business hours as needed  Ability to work under tight deadlines and handle simultaneous, varied assignments while providing consistent quality and accuracy  Willingness to travel in support of remote projects and teams

description: OverviewKimley-Horn, one of FORTUNE Magazine's "100 Best Companies to Work For", is looking for a dynamic and energetic Human Resources Partner (HRP) for our Mountain Pacific region. title: On-site Recruiter
description: OverviewKimley-Horn, one of Fortune Magazine's "100 Best Companies to Work For", is a dynamic and rapidly growing consutling firm specializing in planning and engineering. Our team of talented professionals is dedicated to providing exceptional client service while upholding our core values of honesty, integrity, and sustained profitability. We believe in creating an environment where our people can flourish, and we are looking for a Mid-Level Recruiter to join our team in Denver, CO.As a Mid-Level Recruiter, you will play a vital role in attracting and selecting top talent for our organization. You will collaborate closely with hiring managers, understand their staffing needs, and execute effective recruiting strategies to identify and engage qualified candidates. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to our growth and shape the future of our team.ResponsibilitiesWork closely with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and develop effective recruitment strategies.Utilize various sourcing techniques such as job boards, social media, networking events, and employee referrals to identify and attract qualified candidates.Review resumes, conduct phone screens, and interview candidates to assess their skills, experience, and cultural fit.Partner with recruiting team working together collectively to find the best solutations and creative ideas to attract and hire talent.Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and provide timely feedback to candidates.Conduct reference checks and background screenings as required.Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in our applicant tracking system.Collaborate with the HR team to ensure a seamless onboarding process for new hires.Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging recruitment technologies to continuously improve our recruiting processes.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.Minimum of 3+ years of experience in recruitment, preferably in a similar industry or niche.Proven track record of successfully sourcing and selecting qualified candidates.Strong knowledge of various sourcing techniques and recruitment tools.Strong organizational skills, drive to Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with hiring managers and candidates.Exceptional organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems and other recruitment software.How to Apply: If you are a motivated and results-oriented individual who thrives in a collaborative and growth-focused environment, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your qualifications and interest in the Mid-Level Recruiter position in Denver, CO.Why Kimley-HornWe are a full-service consulting firm that provides a wide range of infrastructure and land development planning and engineering services to both public and private clients. Though we have more than 7,000 employees in over 100 offices, we pride ourselves on our small company feel.Our commitment to quality is only as good as the people behind it—that’s why we recruit passionate, hardworking, and proactive employees. By joining Kimley-Horn, you’ll be joining a firm whose core values and core purpose are more than just words on paper—they form the basis of a culture that has yielded success since 1967. Kimley-Horn has been recognized 16 times as one of the "Top Companies to Work For". Salary Range $80,000-$100,000  Eligible for performance-based bonus compensation

description: OverviewAre you creative, resourceful, talented, and ready to get to work in Philadelphia? Do you like a fast-paced environment that rewards success? Join Kimley-Horn’s growing marketing team and get hands-on experience developing strategy, coordinating and writing proposals, collaborating on client strategies, writing thought leadership, and promoting the firm.Responsibilities Prepare/write proposals, qualifications, letters, reports, presentations, brochures, award submittals, and other communications  Facilitate, coordinate, and participate in kick-off meetings and proposal production activities  Coordinate with consultant firms for teaming and gathering marketing materials  Communicate and interact with professionals, project managers, and technical staff  Conduct marketing database queries as well as input data and maintain accuracy of data on an ongoing basis  Coordinate other special projects such as conferences, open houses, and client events  Interview subject matter experts and write/edit technical content for target audiences Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Communication, Marketing, Education, or other relevant major  Strong technical writing, editing, interpersonal, and organizational skills  Software proficiency in Microsoft Office Word and Adobe InDesign  Willingness to travel if needed  0-4 years of professional consulting service experience is required; A/E/C industry experience is a plus Please include a one-page cover letter when uploading your resume. Additional work samples and/or basic writing skills testing will be required.About Kimley-HornWe are a full-service consulting firm that provides a wide range of infrastructure and land development planning and engineering services to both public and private clients. Though we have more than 7,000 employees in 110+ offices, we pride ourselves on our small company feel.At Kimley-Horn, we do things differently. People—clients and employees—are at the forefront of our business. Clients know we are laser-focused on their success. Employees know our culture and approach to business are built on a desire to see our staff flourish, one and all. Both groups know that with Kimley-Horn, they can expect more and experience better.Our commitment to quality is only as good as the people behind it—that’s why we recruit passionate, hardworking, and proactive employees. By joining Kimley-Horn, you’ll be joining a firm whose core values and core purpose are more than just words on paper—they form the basis of a culture that has yielded success since 1967. 16 years on Fortune’s "100 Best Companies to Work For"  including Best Workplaces for Women and Best Workplaces for Millennials.

title: Electrical Engineering Analyst
description: OverviewKimley-Horn is looking for Electrical Engineering graduates to join our St. Petersburg, Florida (FL) office! This is not a remote position.ResponsibilitiesUtilize technical software programs on a regular basis to analyze, produce, and QC deliverables for our clients.Solve complex problems, assist project managers, and collaborate across disciplines to produce our clients’ visions for the future built environment.Develop familiarity with the federal, state, and local regulations, as well as Kimley-Horn’s and our client’s practices, procedures, and standards.Our Electrical teams work on a wide variety of projects, such as building MEP, photometrics and lighting, power distribution, EV charging, security and communications, industrial controls, and more. Gain exposure to Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) Design – traffic operations centers, sensors, message signs, closed circuit TV cameras (CCTV), fiber optic networks.Assist with echnical specification and report writing electrical equipment cost research. Growth Opportunities As an Electrical Engineering Analyst with Kimley-Horn, you will benefit from hands-on experience, technical software and consulting trainings, and developmental programs geared towards growing Kimley-Horn’s future leaders. We expect Analysts to achieve EIT/EI certification and provide financial resources to help you succeed. You will also gain exposure to managing tasks and client relationships.We believe mentorship should be formed naturally and organically. Kimley-Horn provides ample opportunities to facilitate the best mentor relationships for you! These opportunities include, but are not limited to, employee resource groups, lunch and learns, networking events, national training programs, volunteer events, and social outings.At Kimley-Horn, we do things differently. People, clients and employees, are at the forefront of who we are. Clients know we prioritize achieving their goals and growing their success. Employees know our culture and approach to business are built on a desire to provide an environment for everyone to flourish. Our commitment to quality is only as good as the people behind it— that’s why we welcome and develop passionate, hardworking, and proactive employees. We take pride in how our employee retention, robust benefits package, and company values have led to Kimley-Horn’s placement on the Fortune “100 Best Companies to Work” list for 16 years!QualificationsAn ABET accredited Electrical Engineering degree (Bachelors or Masters) by Summer 2024.

title: Senior Marketing Specialist
description: OverviewOur Reston, Virginia office is looking for a Marketing Specialist with 10+ years of A/E/C experience to join our firmwide marketing team. This national role will focus on identifying, relationship building, pursuing, and developing proposal strategies for targeted Industrial clients and projects. This is an in-office position.Responsibilities Assist in business development activities to ensure adequate, profitable new business is captured. Research business opportunities and assist in strategy development. Positively represent Kimley-Horn via active engagement in networking events, activities, and organizations. Partner with project managers to strategize on their market forecast, upcoming opportunities, and other potential clients/projects. Partner with the regional Marketing team to ensure proper support to project managers. Favorably position the firm for existing and future market opportunities. Support and lead (when appropriate) marketing efforts for proposals, presentations, and other direct work-winning activities. Coordinate special projects/events, including regional conferences Manage multiple concurrent time-sensitive deadlinesQualifications Bachelor’s in Communications, Journalism, Marketing, Public Relations, English, or a similar field 10+ years of A/E/C industry experience Flexibility to work outside normal working hours Willingness to occasionally travel (as required) for business needs Basic knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office Confident communicator Detail-oriented and proactive Team player with a positive attitude/client service mentality Strong ability to gather, interpret, and convey technical information

title: In-house Counsel
description: OverviewKimley-Horn, one of Fortune Magazine’s “100 Best Companies to Work For,” is looking for an in-house counsel to join our corporate legal team in Raleigh, NC. This is a great opportunity, whether you are currently working as in-house counsel or interested in making a shift from private or public practice.This position will work with General Counsel and the legal team in managing a broad range of contracting, compliance, legal and risk matters for the company and its affiliates in a time sensitive environment. Candidates should have 2+ years of experience.Responsibilities Provide rapid, practical, business-oriented, and risk-aware legal advice Draft, review, and negotiate various design professional contracts and other legal documents Enhance standard contracting procedures and provide training Prepare and present legal trainings and risk management seminars to staff on a wide range of legal, risk, and compliance topics Manage operational compliance functions Collaborate with project personnel to proactively identify, assess, and mitigate risks and advise on dispute avoidance and risk mitigation strategies Coordinate efforts of and manage outside attorneys on a case-by-case basis Support subpoena and claims/litigation management, working with General Counsel, outside counsel, insurance representatives, and internal stakeholders as needed Support contracting, risk and compliance efforts for operations Collaborate with and facilitate cross-team decision-making amongst various internal stakeholders, including legal, finance, senior management, and other internal teams Perform other duties as needed Some travel required (approx. 10%)Qualifications Juris Doctor degree from an accredited law school Licensed to practice law in a U.S. state or Washington, D.C. 2+ years of legal experience Strong interpersonal skills, including verbal communication, presentation, and relationship building Exceptionally organized in thought and with documentation Ability to maintain confidentiality and provide excellent internal and external client service Excellent follow-through skills as well as the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment Ability and desire to partner with diverse and dynamic leadership and teams Proficient in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook Prior experience in Intellectual Property/Technology law is a plus

title: Graphic Designer
description: Overview At Kimley-Horn, our in-house creative teams are integral to every aspect of our business. We use design to differentiate Kimley-Horn in the marketplace; to create understanding around and excitement for projects in local communities; and to energize and connect our employees. The following is a description of a Graphic Designer in our regional Marketing department.If you are mapping out the next phase of your design career and seeking creative opportunities with an entrepreneurial spirit, join Kimley-Horn’s Design team in Atlanta Midtown. Our Graphic Designers work independently, partnering with Junior Designers and other Marketing professionals to understand and translate the client’s vision and design a variety of deliverables in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Exploration of personal growth, new skills, and leadership opportunities are part of Kimley-Horn’s culture and encouraged in this position. Hop on board! Responsibilities As a Graphic Designer on our Marketing team, you will be responsible for the creative development of a wide variety of deliverables in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary team environment. The ideal candidate will be an energetic, focused, multi-talented design professional with a mix of graphic design and multimedia skills that will enable multi-tasking in WordPress, email, presentation design, and collateral development.This is an in-office position.Responsibilities: Develop graphic covers, templates, layouts, and supporting graphics for marketing pursuits  Create presentations, aerial map exhibits, and multimedia graphics  Create tailored, print and digital brochures as well as conference/event graphics  Design digital campaigns for external recognition/pursuits  Thrive as part of a large, creative, and specialized marketing team  Partner with engineers, project managers, and technical staff  Serve as a brand advocate for Kimley-Horn and the client’s visual guidelines  Qualifications  BA/BS in Graphic Design or similar  2+ years of corporate and/or agency experience  Proficiency in Adobe CC (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, and Acrobat) and Microsoft Office Suite (Kimley-Horn is a PC-based company)  Ability to use InDesign software for layout of complex documents  Strong verbal and written communication skills  A positive, collaborative, solution-seeking attitude, and a high sense of personal responsibility  Desire to learn new skills, manage tasks and teams, participate in process improvement  Flexibility to periodically work outside normal business hours as needed  Ability to work under tight deadlines and handle simultaneous, varied assignments while providing consistent quality and accuracy  Willingness to travel in support of remote projects and teams

description: OverviewAt Kimley-Horn, our in-house creative teams are integral to every aspect of our business. We use design to differentiate Kimley-Horn in the marketplace; to create understanding around and excitement for projects in local communities; and to energize and connect our employees. The following is a description of a Graphic Designer in our Regional Marketing department.If you are mapping out the next phase of your design career and seeking creative opportunities with an entrepreneurial spirit, join Kimley-Horn’s Design team in Seattle, WA. Our Graphic Designers work independently, partnering with Junior Designers and other Marketing professionals to understand and translate the client’s vision and design a variety of deliverables in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. title: Human Resources Business Partner
description: OverviewKimley-Horn, one of FORTUNE Magazine's "100 Best Companies to Work For", is looking for a dynamic and energetic Human Resources Partner (HRP) for our Mountain Pacific region. This role is based in our Denver, CO office and serves as a dedicated partner and advisor to multiple offices in our Mountain Pacific region, which currently includes offices in CO, ID, OR, UT and WA. In collaboration with other partners, the HRP develops strategies, leads and executes/implements programs and policies to support the region’s initiatives. Additionally, this role will work with the nationwide HR team. This is not a remote opportunity.Responsibilities Propose solutions and engage partners in the areas of retention efforts, general ER concerns, performance management, terminations, teambuilding, complaint/conflict resolution, and career development  Conduct new hire orientations and lead the integration planning for mid-level new hires  Serve as a benefits point-of-contact by responding to questions and educating employees on company benefit programs  Manage leaves of absence, including FMLA and workers’ compensation  Develop and facilitate multiple training programs  Manage special projects that have region-wide and/or company-wide impact  Recruit for administrative, and business support positions, and assist recruiters with interview logistics Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s (or Master’s degree) in Human Resources or related field  A minimum of 6 years of related experience, including experience leading employee relations investigations  Ability to travel to support the needs of the region and firm; overnight travel required occasionally  Knowledge of federal and state labor and employment law  Proficiency in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and HRIS systems  Strong interpersonal skills, including verbal communication, presentation, and relationship building  Excellent organization and follow-through skills as well as the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment with limited daily supervision Ability and desire to work collaboratively with team members within the region, as well as across the firm, to meet goalsAbility to maintain confidentiality and provide excellent internal and external client servicePreferred PHR/SPHR or SHRM-CP/SCP Base Salary Range $85,000 - $110,000

title: On-site Recruiter
description: OverviewKimley-Horn, one of Fortune Magazine's "100 Best Companies to Work For", is a dynamic and rapidly growing consutling firm specializing in planning and engineering. Our team of talented professionals is dedicated to providing exceptional client service while upholding our core values of honesty, integrity, and sustained profitability. We believe in creating an environment where our people can flourish, and we are looking for a Mid-Level Recruiter to join our team in Denver, CO.As a Mid-Level Recruiter, you will play a vital role in attracting and selecting top talent for our organization. You will collaborate closely with hiring managers, understand their staffing needs, and execute effective recruiting strategies to identify and engage qualified candidates. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to our growth and shape the future of our team.ResponsibilitiesWork closely with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and develop effective recruitment strategies.Utilize various sourcing techniques such as job boards, social media, networking events, and employee referrals to identify and attract qualified candidates.Review resumes, conduct phone screens, and interview candidates to assess their skills, experience, and cultural fit.Partner with recruiting team working together collectively to find the best solutations and creative ideas to attract and hire talent.Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and provide timely feedback to candidates.Conduct reference checks and background screenings as required.Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in our applicant tracking system.Collaborate with the HR team to ensure a seamless onboarding process for new hires.Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging recruitment technologies to continuously improve our recruiting processes.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.Minimum of 3+ years of experience in recruitment, preferably in a similar industry or niche.Proven track record of successfully sourcing and selecting qualified candidates.Strong knowledge of various sourcing techniques and recruitment tools.Strong organizational skills, drive to Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with hiring managers and candidates.Exceptional organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems and other recruitment software.How to Apply: If you are a motivated and results-oriented individual who thrives in a collaborative and growth-focused environment, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your qualifications and interest in the Mid-Level Recruiter position in Denver, CO.Why Kimley-HornWe are a full-service consulting firm that provides a wide range of infrastructure and land development planning and engineering services to both public and private clients. Though we have more than 7,000 employees in over 100 offices, we pride ourselves on our small company feel.Our commitment to quality is only as good as the people behind it—that’s why we recruit passionate, hardworking, and proactive employees. By joining Kimley-Horn, you’ll be joining a firm whose core values and core purpose are more than just words on paper—they form the basis of a culture that has yielded success since 1967. Kimley-Horn has been recognized 16 times as one of the "Top Companies to Work For". Salary Range $80,000-$100,000  Eligible for performance-based bonus compensation

title: Electrical Engineering Analyst - Solar PV Design
description: OverviewKimley-Horn is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our Raleigh, NC team as an Entry Level Electrical Engineer in Solar PV, BESS, Electric Vehicle Charging, and Photometric Design. In this role, you will work under the guidance of experienced engineers to support the design and development of solar photovoltaic (PV) systems, battery energy storage systems (BESS), electric vehicle charging (EVCs) sites, and photometric design. This is an excellent opportunity for an upcoming or recent graduate to gain hands-on experience in the renewable energy industry. Please note: this is not a remote position.Responsibilities Assist in the design and layout of solar PV systems, BESS, and EVCs sites including site analysis, system sizing, and equipment selection.  Conduct electrical system analysis, including load calculations, voltage drop analysis, and short circuit calculations.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure effective integration of solar PV systems into existing electrical infrastructure.  Prepare technical drawings, specifications, and other design documents using computer-aided design (CAD) software.  Support the procurement process by preparing requests for proposals (RFPs) and evaluating bids from equipment suppliers.  Conduct field visits to solar PV project sites to gather data and verify design parameters.  Assist in the preparation of construction documents, including electrical wiring diagrams, equipment specifications, and installation guidelines.  Stay updated on industry trends, codes, and standards related to solar PV systems, and apply this knowledge to design projects.  Collaborate with project managers to ensure timely completion of design deliverables within budgetary constraints.  Maintain accurate project documentation, including design calculations, drawings, and correspondence. Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may perform other related duties as required to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. Growth Opportunities As an Electrical Engineering Analyst with Kimley-Horn, you will benefit from hands-on experience, technical software and consulting trainings, and developmental programs geared towards growing Kimley-Horn’s future leaders. We expect Analysts to achieve EIT/EI certification and provide financial resources to help you succeed. You will also gain exposure to managing tasks and client relationships.We believe mentorship should be formed naturally and organically. Kimley-Horn provides ample opportunities to facilitate the best mentor relationships for you! These opportunities include, but are not limited to, employee resource groups, lunch and learns, networking events, national training programs, volunteer events, and social outings.At Kimley-Horn, we do things differently. People, clients and employees, are at the forefront of who we are. Clients know we prioritize achieving their goals and growing their success. Employees know our culture and approach to business are built on a desire to provide an environment for everyone to flourish. Our commitment to quality is only as good as the people behind it— that’s why we welcome and develop passionate, hardworking, and proactive employees. We take pride in how our employee retention, robust benefits package, and company values have led to Kimley-Horn’s placement on the Fortune “100 Best Companies to Work” list for 16 years!QualificationsAn ABET accredited Electrical Engineering degree (Bachelors or Masters) by Summer 2024.Knowledge of solar PV systems and their design considerations is preferred.Proficiency in computer-aided design (CAD) software, such as AutoCAD or Revit.Familiarity with electrical system analysis tools, such as ETAP, SKM, or PVSyst, is a plus.Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in a team environment.Strong attention to detail and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.Self-motivated and eager to learn and grow in the field of solar PV design.

description: OverviewAt Kimley ‐ Horn, one of the nation's premier planning and design consultants, our professionals are experts in many disciplines yet share one passion: making our clients successful. Looking for a terrific place to grow your career? Ranked consistently as one of Fortune Magazine’s “100 Best Companies to Work For,” Kimley ‐ Horn and Associates, Inc. prides itself on hiring high ‐ achieving, dedicated, and reliable professionals. We are looking for a motivated Civil Analyst to join our Transportation Planning and Traffic Operations (TPTO) team in our Los Angeles office.ResponsibilitiesThe successful candidate will perform traffic engineering and project management tasks to deliver a wide variety of transportation planning, transit, traffic engineering, safety, and intelligent transportation systems (ITS) projects for many, diverse clients. In addition to serving our existing clients, this Civil Analyst will have an entrepreneurial spirit, creating a vision for growth in their personal practice while contributing to the growth of our well-established transportation engineering practice in the Los Angeles area. Our engineers manage their projects profitably, engage in hands-on practice and delivery of projects, transition work to qualified staff, and act as a positive leader and mentor. They contribute significantly to marketing and business development efforts and have the autonomy to pursue their own passions, leads, and clients.Beyond the professional career satisfaction and growth opportunities, Kimley-Horn’s benefits are exceptional because of our people and their contributions to the success of the firm. Consistent with our core value of “Sharing and Caring,” these benefits include competitive salaries, an exceptional bonus program, healthcare benefit package options with no monthly premium, 401k contribution with 8-percent company match plus additional profit sharing, and the potential to advance to ownership.Qualifications 3+ years of relevant engineering experience in transportation planning, traffic engineering and design, traffic operations, and/or ITS planning and design  BS or MS from an ABET accredited university in the field of Civil Engineering or Transportation Engineering  Registered E.I.T. or P.E. (or the ability to obtain reciprocity within one year)  Excellent written and oral communication skills  Proficiency in Synchro, HCS, and/or Vissim software applications desired  Ability to work in a team environment, balance priorities among multiple projects, and effectively communicate and collaborate at all levels of the organization  Ability to manage and mentor staff, and direct resources effectively in a positive manner  Ability to provide high-quality deliverables with exceptional client service  Business development and marketing experience including writing proposals, developing scopes of work, and assembling budgets for projected work. Why Kimley-HornWe are a full-service consulting firm that provides a wide range of infrastructure and land development planning and engineering services to both public and private clients. Though we have more than 5,000 employees in over 100 offices, we pride ourselves on our small company feel. Our commitment to quality is only as good as the people behind it—that’s why we recruit passionate, hardworking, and proactive employees. By joining Kimley-Horn, you’ll be joining a firm whose core values and core purpose are more than just words on paper—they form the basis of a culture that has yielded success since 1967.Kimley-Horn has been recognized 15 times as one of the "Best Companies to Work For". Base Salary Range$80,000 - $110,000

description: OverviewKimley-Horn, one of FORTUNE Magazine’s “100 Best Companies to Work For,” is seeking a Civil EIT/Engineer to join our MEP team in Phoenix, AZ.Responsibilities Design of electrical systems for healthcare, transportation (ITS), aviation, and energy (solar and EV Infrastructure) projects  Participate on project teams in an active production role  Preparation of project specifications  Preparation of electrical construction cost estimates  Daily interaction and collaboration on multi-disciplinary teams  Coordination and verification of as-built drawings  Perform quality work that meets or exceeds client expectations  Responsible for the development of reports and design documents, including electrical floor plans, equipment schematic diagrams, equipment block diagrams, equipment load calculations, and connection diagrams Qualifications 3+ years of experience in consulting electrical engineering  Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering (advanced degrees are a plus)  EIT required; PE desired  Firm understanding of the National Electrical Code, other NFPA codes/standards, and energy codes  Proficiency using Computer-Aided Design and Drafting (AutoCAD) is required  Proficiency in Microsoft Office apps - Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.  Building Information Modeling (BIM – Autodesk Revit) experience is a plus  Security and communication design experience is a plus  Experience in Power Studies, such as Short Circuit Study, Coordination Study, and Arc Flash Analy sis (SKM PowerTools), AGI32 is a plus  Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required  The ability to work independently or in a team environment effectively  The ability to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment Why Kimley-Horn: We are a full-service consulting firm that provides a wide range of infrastructure and land development planning and engineering services to both public and private clients. Though we have over 7,000 employees in over 100 offices, we pride ourselves on our small company feel. Our commitment to quality is only as good as the people behind it. By joining Kimley-Horn, you’ll be joining a firm whose core values and core purpose are more than just words on paper; they form the basis of a culture that has yielded success since 1967.We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, opportunities for professional development, and a supportive work environment. title: Civil Designer
description: Overview Kimley-Horn, one of FORTUNE Magazine's "100 Best Companies to Work For," is seeking Civil Designer to join our Seattle, Washington team!At Kimley-Horn, we do things differently. People, clients, and employees are at the forefront of who we are. Clients know we prioritize achieving their goals and growing their success. Employees know our culture and approach to business are built on a desire to provide an environment for everyone to flourish. Our commitment to quality is only as good as the people behind it— that’s why we welcome and develop passionate, hardworking, and proactive employees. We take pride in our employee retention, robust benefits package, and company values which have led to Kimley-Horn’s placement on the Fortune “100 Best Companies to Work” list for 16 years! Responsibilities This person will be responsible for civil plan production for various projects, site layout/design, utilities layout/design, file management, and assisting in preparation of submittal packages. Candidate must be proficient at preparing civil construction drawings in Civil 3D. Candidate must be able to work with a team of civil designers and engineers.Responsibilities: Collaborate with project managers, engineers, and other designers to develop creative and innovative design solutions for site development projects.  Prepare detailed site plans, grading plans, utility plans, and other technical drawings using AutoCAD and other design software.  Conduct site visits and field investigations to gather data and assess site conditions.  Assist in the preparation of technical reports, construction documents, and cost estimates.  Qualifications  Associate's Degree preferred.  Proficiency in AutoCAD, Civil 3D, and other design software.  Minimum of 5 years of experience in site development design.  Strong understanding of site grading, stormwater management, and utility design.  Knowledge of local codes and regulations in the Seattle area.  Experience providing mentorship and training staff preferred.  Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team. Salary Range: $100,000 - $140,000  Eligible for performance based bonus compensation.  16 years on Fortune’s "100 Best Companies to Work For," including Best Workplaces for Women and Best Workplaces for Millennials.
